priorVersion.title: ECG Test or Examination Short Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGTESTCD

self.title: ECG Test or Examination Short Name

datasetVariables.description:
Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in EGTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in EGTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). EGTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples : "PRAG", "QRSAG".
Test codes are in two separate codelists, one for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTESTCD) and one for tests based on Holter monitoring (HETESTCD).
datasetVariables.label: ECG Test or Examination Short Name
datasetVariables.name: EGTESTCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGTEST

datasetVariables.description:
Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in EGTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "PR Interval, Aggregate", "QRS Duration, Aggregate".
Test names are in two separate codelists, one for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTEST) and one for tests based on Holter monitoring (HETEST).
datasetVariables.label: ECG Test or Examination Name
datasetVariables.name: EGTEST

datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120522
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71150

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGSTRESC

datasetVariables.description:
Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from EGORRES in a standard format or standard units. EGSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in EGSTRESN. For example, if a test has results of "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in EGORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in EGSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions. Additional examples of result data: "SINUS BRADYCARDIA", "ATRIAL FLUTTER", "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION".
Test results are in two separate codelists, one for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGSTRESC) and one for tests based on Holter monitoring (HESTRESC).
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: EGSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from EGSTRESC. EGSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: EGSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized units used for EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: EGSTRESU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If EGDRVFL = "Y", then EGORRES could be null, with EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN (if the result is numeric) having the derived value.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: EGDRVFL

datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: EGEVAL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (EGTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: EGELTM

datasetVariables.name: EGTPTREF

description: A findings domain that contains ECG data, including position of the subject, method of evaluation, all cycle measurements and all findings from the ECG including an overall interpretation if collected or derived. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49626, 2018-06-29)
label: ECG Test Results
name: EG
